contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|PH|pH|ph}} '''[[pH]]''' is a measure of acidity or alkalinity. '''PH''', '''ph''', '''pH''', and '''Ph''' may also refer to: ==Sciences== * [[PH (complexity)]], the union of all complexity classes in the polynomial hierarchy in computational complexity theory * [[Phenyl group]], either -Ph or Φ, highly-stable and aromatic hydrocarbon unit found in many organic compounds * [[phot]], or ph, a measurement of illuminance (photometry) * pico- [[henry (unit)]], an SI Unit of electrical inductance * [[Pleckstrin homology]] domain, a part of many proteins which bind phosphoinositides with high affinity * [[Pulmonary hypertension]], a medical condition * [[Soil pH]] is a measure of soil acidity or soil alkalinity ==Aviation== * PH, [[Aircraft registration]] prefix for the Netherlands * [[Polynesian Airlines]]' IATA airline designator * [[Transavia.com Denmark]]'s IATA airline designator ==Other uses== * PH, the [[Philippines]]' ISO country code ** [[.ph]], the Philippines' Internet country code top-level domain * A [[Post-nominal letters|post-nominal]] designation for recipients of the [[Purple Heart]] * [[pʰ]], a phoneme * [[Ph (digraph)]], a common digraph that represents the phoneme /f/ (voiceless labiodental fricative) in phonetics * Ph protocol, an early web database search for [[CCSO Nameserver]] described by RFC 2378 * [[Planet Hunters]], a group that hunts for exoplanets * [[Poul Henningsen]] (1894–1967) Danish writer and designer referred to as PH in Denmark * PH, [[public house]] (an abbreviation used on maps) ==See also== * [[phi]], the Greek letter (φ) {{disambiguation}}
